alert.note: Alert for Cook; Kane (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 25 at 8:12PM CDT until May 26 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following areas, Cook and Kane. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 809 PM CDT, doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen, with a few isolated locations receiving up to 2.5 inches of rainfall over the last few hours. - Showers and thunderstorms moving over the same areas may produce additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch in portions of the area. - Some locations that may experience minor flooding include... Aurora, Elgin, Hoffman Estates, Bartlett, Streamwood, Carpentersville, St. Charles, Algonquin, West Chicago, Batavia, Huntley, Geneva, Campton Hills, Barrington, South Elgin, North Aurora, Pingree Grove, Gilberts, West Dundee and Elburn. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
